issue.title: Electron 3.0.x: Object has been destroyed upon quit with multiple windows open

labels.name: upstream
labels.description: Issue identified as 'upstream' component related (exists outside of VS Code)

labels.name: electron
labels.description: Issues and items related to Electron

body:
Confirming this issue on Windows 7 x64 as well. 

This didn't seem to be a problem in 3.0 betas 7 and 8, though it's possible that I just didn't run into it.

issue.title: fix: Invalidate weak ptrs before window Javascript object is destroyed

body:
It looks like everything is under control here, but for good measure:

Appending my last report, I've been able to recreate this on `3.0.0-beta.7` on Windows 7.

@Slapbox the above PR fixes the regression caused by https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/14453 in `3.0.0-beta.10`, can you provide a minimal test case for the issue you are seeing in `3.0.0-beta.7`. Thanks!

I could have chosen my words better. I've only run into it once. I was surprised by it, but I dug into my `node_modules` and saw that I was indeed on `beta.7.` If I run into this again I'll try to produce a repo.

@deepak1556 I've not narrowed it down completely yet, but it seems to only occur if a window besides the first one created is paused in the debugger when you use `app.quit()`. If this is correct, it should hardly be a concern for production. It's possible this comes from my own code somehow.

issue.title: fix: Invalidate weak ptrs before window Javascript object is destroyed (backport: 3-0-x)
